page.title: 19Land Reclamation
page.content: In the mid 1950s Ashtree Farm enjoyed rough grazing from Purewell to the harbour foreshore.Salt marshes fed by 3 streams flowing under the Purewell shingle bank stretched from the eastern branch of the Avon to the creek along Stanpit,north of Tutton's Well,where fishermen cleaned and dried their nets.Westwards from the 'Ship in Distress'to the Avon a band of 200-300 metres of land has since been reclaimed by the depositing of refuse, its consolidation and surfacing with topsoil.This has enabled the development of a landscaped golf course,playing fields,the indoor sports centre and the swimming pool with parking facilities.Natural silting along Stanpit and Mudeford waterfronts has enabled foreshore property owners to reclaim areas of marshland for garden use.
